turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 2013 Boston College Eagles football team.
turn.1: What was the biggest takeaway from the 2013 Boston College Eagles football team's win over the Utah Valley Aggies?
turn.2: The win ended a 9-game losing streak on the road for the Eagles, their first road win since 2010, while handing the Aggies their 9th loss of their season. BC looks to win their third straight next week against struggling North Carolina State at home, and become bowl eligible for the first time since 2010.
turn.3: Did they end up becoming bowl eligible?
turn.4: On senior day, BC's final home game of the season, the Eagles beat NC State 38–21 and became bowl-eligible for the first time since 2010 due to a record-setting performance by the nation's leading rusher and Doak Walker candidate Andre Williams.
turn.5: What were some of Andre Williams's record setting runs?
turn.6: After breaking the single-game rushing record the previous week at New Mexico State, Williams broke his own record by rushing for 339 yards on 42 carries, scoring 2 touchdowns.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The single-game performance is also the ACC's single-game rushing record, breaking John Leach of Wake Forest's record of 329 yards in 1993. 339 yards was also the highest single-game performance by any FBS running back during the season.
turn.9: Did he break any other records?
turn.10: Williams also surpassed Mike Cloud's single-season BC record of 1,726 yards and put himself 385 yards shorts of BC's career rushing record owned by Montel Harris' 3,757 yards.
turn.11: Did anyone else on the team break any records?
turn.12: Kicker Nate Freese also set a record, becoming the school's all-time leading scorer, with 299 points.
